[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2331053][img]https://www.hackforums.news/assets/v4/notablethreads-mix.png[/img][/url][/align]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Announcements[/b][/color]
[list]
[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6060767][color=#FFFFFF]Set Reminder[/color][/url] - [mention=175033]
A brand-new feature has been added to the site, You may now set yourself a reminder to a thread, this means if you want to check who won a giveaway thread you can set a reminder and set it to a date and you will be sent a reminder about the thread.

[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6060458][color=#FFFFFF]Hackuman Graphics[/color][/url] - [mention=175033]
Hackuman has been updated with its all-new UI look with a massive bit of help thanks to the member known as Novica. If you haven't seen the new hackuman game yet or not even played it yet we are sure you would love to try it and play it since the game UI has been updated. Everything is now very easy to understand so to give it a go.
[/list]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Informational Threads[/b][/color]
[list]
[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6057804][color=#FFFFFF]USA Get some $$$ ~ U.S. Seeks to Send Checks to Americans as Part of Stimulus Package[/color][/url] - [mention=630163]
The USA has started to send out checks to people who are in need of some money due to the fact that they have no income right now because of the whole outbreak of the virus going around. If you are in the USA need some money for food and water, then you could get yourself some with help from this thread.

[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6060879][color=#FFFFFF]Riots popping up near wuhan.[/color][/url] - [mention=3257834]
People have started to riot around Wuhan. Some of the police vehicles were overturned and police scuffled with each other over very large crowds of shouting people, according to a series of videos posted to Chinese social media.
[/list]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Entertaining Threads[/b][/color]
[list]
[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6060790][color=#FFFFFF]Success with Indeed?[/color][/url] - [mention=4269493]
If you haven't heard about the job website known as indeed then you may want to google it. But Shine_ is wondering if anyone on Hack Forums has ever had any luck with finding a good job from the website since they recently relocated and is looking for something near home.

[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6060881][color=#FFFFFF]Anyone an 'Essential' Worker?[/color][/url] - [mention=3297465]
Since no one is allowed outside unless they are working as an "Essential' Worker" or shopping alone or any other emergencies the member called Lowkey wants to know if you are classed as an Essential' Worker or if you are just working from home. 

[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6060648][color=#FFFFFF]When do you think you'll "retire" from HF?[/color][/url] - [mention=957249]
We all leave forums in the long run but when do we all think we will leave the great website Hack Forums. Many people have said they won't be leaving the website in a long time and some other people are saying maybe a few years or when the site just disappears.

[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6060425][color=#FFFFFF]Have you heard of buffs?[/color][/url] - [mention=175033]
Xerotic has made a thread to see if the Hack Forums Community understands the meaning of a buff to something. Most people have posted in the poll on what they believe the meaning is and voted on the poll. Does this mean that there will be buffs coming to hackuman soon?
[/list]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Contests & Giveaways[/b][/color]
[list]
[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6060686][color=#FFFFFF]$200 BTC GIVE AWAY[/color][/url] - [mention=3654285]
A member currently known as Elusiive is hosting a massive $200 giveaway. This is the second big giveaway they have done, and they are hoping whoever wins the money will need the money more than anything.

[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6060965][color=#FFFFFF]$30 BTC Contest | 1 POST PER MEMBER | LET'S MAKE IT FAIR[/color][/url] - [mention=3832660]
Are you sick of giveaways that let other people enter more than once? Well, then you'll love this giveaway because you can only enter once meaning you all have an even chance of winning some easy bitcoin, Make sure to thank the host for the great giveaway.
[/list]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[color=transparent]    [/color]

[align=center][img]https://www.hackforums.news/assets/v4/technews-invisible.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Huawei Getting the Boot[/color][/b]
Huawei is back in the news as US officials find it appropriate to place further restrictions on a company that reportedly has close relations with the Chinese government. This proposed requirement would prohibit international companies that produce smartphone chips to first acquire a license to use "American chip making equipment" before selling any chips to Huawei. This restriction is intended to avoid the selling of specialized chips to major telecommunications companies in China and to supply more common chips. Trump hasn't signed off on any new regulations yet, but if he does, tech companies like Apple and Qualcomm could lose out.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.cnet.com/news/us-officials-reportedly-agree-to-cut-off-huawei-from-global-chip-suppliers/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Amazon’s Alexa To Help Diagnose – COVID-19[/color][/b]
Users of Alexa in Australia, Brazil, Canada, France, India, the UK, and the US can now ask their device for the first steps of diagnosing COVID-19. Some of the questions you might ask Alexa, “Alexa, what do I do if I think I have coronavirus”? or “Alexa, what do I do if I think I have COVID-19?” Alexa will then inquire about your symptoms, travel history, and any other factors that might play a role in the virus. After the information is given, the information will be taken directly from the CDC and transmitted back to the user. Siri and Google Voice Assistant have been fitted with identical features. Alexa’s will also sing a song for 20 seconds, too, and then let you know that you've been washing your hands long enough.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/3/27/21196735/amazon-alexa-covid-19-coronavirus-diagnosis-advice-symptoms-risk-factors-travel] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]US Space Force Has Launched[/color][/b]
The US Space Force has launched its first successful national security mission carrying an “Advanced Extremely High Frequency satellite into orbit.” The rocket named Atlas V was to be launched at 11:37 a.m. PT but was delayed till 1:20 p.m. PT due to a few technical problems. It is the last of the six AEHF satellites to be launched into orbit, providing global, surviving and secure communication capabilities for land, sea and air troops. Trump launched this new military branch back in August and, in January, unveiled the design of Atlas V, alleging that the logo had very similar chrematistics of the Star Treks logo.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.cnet.com/news/trumps-us-space-force-successfully-launches-its-first-national-security-mission/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/gamingnews-redsox.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Call of Duty: Warzone patch adds new mode and weapons, ups the price of loadout drops[/color][/b]
The Call of Duty: Warzone and Modern Warfare fix guaranteed not long ago, which was postponed, has at long last been released to the public. True to their promise, patch notes are split among Warzone and the original base game Modern Warfare. For Warzone, players have the new Plunder: Blood Money variation to anticipate. Blood Money drops money with each murder, and pays extra for completing Bounty Contracts and performing your finishing moves on enemy players. Multiplayer fans get the new Khandor Hideout map, with its own every minute of everyday playlist.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.vg247.com/2020/03/27/call-of-duty-warzone-loadout-drop-price-increase/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]AMD Admits Its New Graphics Tech Has Been Stolen[/color][/b]
Chip-creator AMD has recognized that a programmer took a portion of the organization's graphics IP and is apparently requesting $100 million for its protected return. In an announcement to its site, AMD said it was reached in December 2019 by a person who professed to have access to "test files" for the organization's present and future graphic items. A portion of these files were presented online on the graphics forum GitHub before AMD brought them down with a DMCA notice. This individual has acquired "extra files" past the ones made openly accessible, AMD said. The organization said it's working with law and specialists in its criminal examination.   [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/amd-admits-its-new-graphics-tech-has-been-stolen-r/1100-6475287/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]PS5's Release Shouldn't Be Affected By Coronavirus, Sony Says[/color][/b]
After reaching out to Sony executives regarding the release date of the PS5, all doubt should now be cleared. Sony said that while the Coronavirus is a serious matter that is taking priority in the world, the production of the PS5 is still on schedule, and fans of the previous consoles can continue to hold on to anticipation for the truly next-gen console to be. "Although no issues have emerged so far, Sony is carefully monitoring the risk of delays in production schedules for game software titles at both its first-party studios and partner studios, primarily in Europe and the U.S."  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ps5s-release-shouldnt-be-affected-by-coronavirus-s/1100-6475307/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=4570721][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/animenews-megane.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Crunchyroll Pauses English Dub Releases[/color][/b]
The Crunchyroll team will be hitting the pause button on their future projects. Due to the COVID-19 virus, Crunchyroll wishes to protect its employees by ensuring their safety. With that being said, after March 28, no new dubbed anime will be aired temporarily. This does not mean that anything will be uploaded to the website. Viewers who prefer the original Japanese voices with subtitles of their native language can still expect to see new episodes of currently airing anime, as well as the upcoming anime coming that will be releasing soon for the spring 2020 season. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-03-27/crunchyroll-pauses-english-dub-releases-lists-premiere-dates-for-more-spring-anime/.158036]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Relive My Hero Academia's Amazing School Festival Concert[/color][/b]
In the 23 episodes of My Hero Academia, American songwriter and singer Chrissy Costanza had the chance to show off her powerful singing during U.A.'s school festival, where she temporarily guest-starred as the character Jiro's singing voice. The music video for the song, Hero Too, can be viewed [url=https://youtu.be/GgwUenaQqlM]here[/url]. Watching the video might be cringe-inducing, and some might find it appalling, but give it a watch. You might enjoy it—a very subjective topic. Many fans enjoyed the performance while others did not. What did you think? [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/interest/2020-03-24/relive-my-hero-academia-amazing-school-festival-concert/.157866]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Eromanga Sensei Opens Limited-Time Virtual Store in VRChat[/color][/b]
Loli fans rejoice as you get to emerge yourself into your weird little fantasy. Alright, that was a bit harsh. From now until April 26, gamers who have access to a Virtual Reality device will be able to download a limited-time Eromanga Sensei game where players are warped to a virtual shop based off of the Eromanga Sensei anime. At that virtual shop, you will be able to interact avatars of employees as well as see pop-ups of your favorite characters. There is a limit of 36 people who can join the virtual room at a time. Do note that you cannot purchase any of the items you see within the store; it is purely for entertainment purposes.
[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/interest/2020-03-22/eromanga-sensei-opens-limited-time-virtual-store-in-vrchat/.157722]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Professor Turns Into An Anime Schoolgirl To Teach His Students[/color][/b]
With the COVID-19 epidemic being global, various schools around the globe have switched to online learning. Universities are starting to use services such as Zoom to provide a virtual learning experience for university students. With that being said, a teacher at Shanghai University is doing something a little different. To keep his students entertained and focused on the coursework, he is using digital anime avatars to replace himself. If you have ever seen a V-Tuber, otherwise known as a Virtual YouTuber, you will understand what this looks like. For those who have no clue, check out this [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IOw8GmnGuAw]here[/url]! Prepare to be weirded out if this is new to you. It doesn't hurt to have a little fun, right? [i][size=x-small][url=https://kotaku.com/professor-turns-into-an-anime-schoolgirl-to-teach-his-s-1842374594]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color][/size][/font]
